properties.name: name
properties.jsdoc: The name of the app.

properties.name: description
properties.jsdoc: A description for the app.

properties.name: assignToken
properties.jsdoc: Whether to assign the user token.

returnTypeDetails.name: name
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The app name. You are allowed to create multiple apps with the same name, in the same realm, because they will have different dbid values. We urge you to be careful about doing this.

returnTypeDetails.name: description
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The description for the app. If this property is left out, the app description will be blank.

returnTypeDetails.name: created
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The time and date the app was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

returnTypeDetails.name: updated
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The time and date the app was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

returnTypeDetails.name: dateFormat
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A description of the format used when displaying date values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the API Guide for how time values are returned in API calls. See [About Localizing Dates](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/about_localizing_dates_numbers.html) to set the app’s date format.

returnTypeDetails.name: timeZone
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A description of the time zone used when displaying time values in this app. Note that this is a browser-only parameter - see the [Field type details](../fieldInfo) page in the portal for how time values are returned in API calls. See [Set the Time Zone for Both the Application and the Account](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/application_local_timezone.html) to set the application’s time zone.

returnTypeDetails.name: memoryInfo
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Application memory info

returnTypeDetails.name: id
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The unique identifier for this application.

returnTypeDetails.name: hasEveryoneOnTheInternet
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Indicates whether app includes Everyone On The Internet access. See [Sharing apps with Everyone on the Internet (EOTI).](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/share_with_everyone_on_internet.html)

returnTypeDetails.name: variables
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The app variables. See [About Application Variables](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/variables.html)

returnTypeDetails.name: dataClassification
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The Data Classification label assigned to the application. If Data Classification is not turned on, this will not be returned. If Data Classification is turned on, but application is not labeled, we return “None".  Data Classification labels can be added in the Admin Console by a Realm Administrator for Platform+ plans.

returnTypeDetails.name: securityProperties
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Security properties of the application

properties.jsdoc: The name for the table.

properties.jsdoc: The singular noun for records...

properties.name: pluralRecordName

returnTypeDetails.name: name
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The name of the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: id
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: alias
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The automatically-created table alias for the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: description
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The description of the table, as configured by an application administrator.

returnTypeDetails.name: created
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The time and date when the table was created, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

returnTypeDetails.name: updated
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The time and date when the table schema or data was last updated, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

returnTypeDetails.name: nextRecordId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The incremental Record ID that will be used when the next record is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

returnTypeDetails.name: nextFieldId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The incremental Field ID that will be used when the next field is created, as determined when the API call was ran.

returnTypeDetails.name: defaultSortFieldId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The id of the field that is configured for default sorting.

returnTypeDetails.name: defaultSortOrder
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The configuration of the default sort order on the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: keyFieldId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The id of the field that is configured to be the key on this table, which is usually the Quickbase Record ID.

returnTypeDetails.name: singleRecordName
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The builder-configured singular noun of the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: pluralRecordName
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The builder-configured plural noun of the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: sizeLimit
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The size limit for the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: spaceUsed
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The amount of space currently being used by the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: spaceRemaining
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The amount of space remaining for use by the table.

parameters.name: tableId

returnTypeDetails.name: items
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: This is simple example of report schema for more details please refer [Report types page](../reportTypes)

properties.name: id
properties.jsdoc: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

properties.name: name
properties.jsdoc: The configured name of the report.

properties.name: type
properties.jsdoc: The type of report in Quickbase (e.g., chart).

properties.name: description
properties.jsdoc: The configured description of a report.

properties.name: ownerId
properties.jsdoc: Optional, showed only for personal reports. The user ID of report owner.

properties.name: query
properties.jsdoc: The query definition as configured in Quickbase that gets executed when the report is run.

properties.name: properties
properties.jsdoc: A list of properties specific to the report type. To see a detailed description of the properties for each report type, See [Report Types.](../reportTypes)

properties.name: usedLast
properties.jsdoc: The instant at which a report was last used.

properties.name: usedCount
properties.jsdoc: The number of times a report has been used.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of table.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: id
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: name
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The configured name of the report.

returnTypeDetails.name: type
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The type of report in Quickbase (e.g., chart).

returnTypeDetails.name: description
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The configured description of a report.

returnTypeDetails.name: ownerId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Optional, showed only for personal reports. The user ID of report owner.

returnTypeDetails.name: query
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The query definition as configured in Quickbase that gets executed when the report is run.

returnTypeDetails.name: properties
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of properties specific to the report type. To see a detailed description of the properties for each report type, See [Report Types.](../reportTypes)

returnTypeDetails.name: usedLast
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The instant at which a report was last used.

returnTypeDetails.name: usedCount
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The number of times a report has been used.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The identifier of the table for the report.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of records to skip. You can set this value when paginating through a set of results.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to return. You can override the default Quickbase pagination to get more or fewer results. If your requested value here exceeds the dynamic maximums, we will return a subset of results and the rest can be gathered in subsequent API calls.

parameters.name: reportId
parameters.description: The identifier of the report, unique to the table.

returnTypeDetails.name: fields
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: An array of objects that contains limited meta-data of each field displayed in the report. This assists in building logic that depends on field types and IDs.

returnTypeDetails.name: data
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: An array of objects that either represents the record data or summarized values, depending on the report type.

returnTypeDetails.name: metadata
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (dbid) of the table.

parameters.name: includeFieldPerms
parameters.description: Set to 'true' if you'd like to get back the custom permissions for the field(s).

properties.name: id
properties.jsdoc: The id of the field, unique to this table.

properties.name: fieldType
properties.jsdoc: The type of field, as described [here](https://help.quickbase.com/user-assistance/field_types.html).

properties.name: mode
properties.jsdoc: For derived fields, this will be 'lookup', 'summary', or 'formula', to indicate the type of derived field.  For non-derived fields, this will be blank.

properties.name: label
properties.jsdoc: The label (name) of the field.

properties.name: noWrap
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is configured to not wrap when displayed in the product.

properties.name: bold
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is configured to display in bold in the product.

properties.name: required
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is marked required.

properties.name: appearsByDefault
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is marked as a default in reports.

properties.name: findEnabled
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is marked as searchable.

properties.name: unique
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is marked unique.

properties.name: doesDataCopy
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field data will copy when a user copies the record.

properties.name: fieldHelp
properties.jsdoc: The configured help text shown to users within the product.

properties.name: audited
properties.jsdoc: Indicates if the field is being tracked as part of Quickbase Audit Logs.

properties.name: properties

returnTypeDetails.name: metadata
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Additional information about the results that may be helpful. Pagination may be needed if either you specify a smaller number of results to skip than is available, or if the API automatically returns fewer results. numRecords can be compared to totalRecords to determine if further pagination is needed.

name: getTempTokenDBID
summary: Get a temporary token for a dbid

parameters.name: dbid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of an app or table.

parameters.name: qBAppToken
parameters.description: Your Quickbase app token

returnTypeDetails.name: temporaryAuthorization
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Temporary authorization token.

parameters.name: body
parameters.type: { grant_type?: string; requested_token_type?: string; subject_token?: string; subject_token_type?: string }

returnTypeDetails.name: access_token
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The security token issued by the authorization server in response to the token exchange request. The identifier `access_token` is used for historical reasons and the issued token need not be an OAuth access token.

returnTypeDetails.name: issued_token_type
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: An identifier for the representation of the issued security token.

returnTypeDetails.name: token_type
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Will always return `N_A`

returnTypeDetails.name: active
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Whether the user token is active.

returnTypeDetails.name: apps
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The list of apps this user token is assigned to.

returnTypeDetails.name: lastUsed
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The last date this user token was used, in the ISO 8601 time format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ (in UTC time zone).

returnTypeDetails.name: description
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: User Token description.

returnTypeDetails.name: id
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: User Token id.

returnTypeDetails.name: name
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: User Token name.

returnTypeDetails.name: token
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: User Token value.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to get users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

returnTypeDetails.name: users
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users found in an account with the given criterias

returnTypeDetails.name: metadata
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Additional request information

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to deny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

returnTypeDetails.name: failure
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that couldn't be denied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

returnTypeDetails.name: success
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that have successfully been denied.

name: denyUsersAndGroups
summary: Deny and remove users from groups

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to deny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

parameters.name: shouldDeleteFromGroups
parameters.description: Specifies if the users should also be removed from all groups.

returnTypeDetails.name: failure
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that couldn't be denied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

returnTypeDetails.name: success
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that have successfully been denied.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account id being used to undeny users. If no value is specified, the first account associated with the requesting user token is chosen.

returnTypeDetails.name: failure
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that couldn't be undenied. This also includes the ID's of users that are not valid.

returnTypeDetails.name: success
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that have successfully been undenied.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

returnTypeDetails.name: failure
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that couldn’t be added to the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users and users who have already been added to the group.

returnTypeDetails.name: success
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that have been added to the group successfully.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

returnTypeDetails.name: failure
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that couldn’t be removed from the group. This includes a list of IDs that represent invalid users.

returnTypeDetails.name: success
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: A list of users that have been removed from the group successfully.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: This is the ID of the group being modified.

returnTypeDetails.name: success

parameters.name: gid

returnTypeDetails.name: failure

returnTypeDetails.name: success

parameters.name: gid

parameters.name: body
parameters.type: { nextToken?: string; numRows?: number; queryId?: string; date?: string; topics?: string[] }

returnTypeDetails.name: queryId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Query id of the requested audit log.

returnTypeDetails.name: events
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: All events of the audit log.

returnTypeDetails.name: nextToken
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Token to fetch the next 1000 logs.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The date for which read summaries need to be fetched. This must be date-time only, as YYYY-MM-DD, and a valid date in the past.

returnTypeDetails.name: date
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The date of the requested summary.

returnTypeDetails.name: reads
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Total reads for the specified date.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The ID of the account to query. If no value is specified, the first account matching the provided domain is chosen.

parameters.name: body
parameters.type: { start?: string; end?: string; groupBy?: string; nextToken?: string; where?: { id?: string; type?: string }[] }

returnTypeDetails.name: accountId
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The ID of the account the events are associated with.

returnTypeDetails.name: start
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The start date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

returnTypeDetails.name: end
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The end date and time of the requested summaries in ISO 8601 time format.

returnTypeDetails.name: groupBy
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: How the events should be grouped.

properties.name: id
properties.jsdoc: Id of the item to filter by.

properties.name: type
properties.jsdoc: The type of item to filter by.

returnTypeDetails.name: results
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: An array of objects that contains Application/User information and an events object with summaries by event type.

properties.name: eventTypes
properties.jsdoc: An array of events that contains specific information associated with an Application/User broken down by event type.

properties.name: billingCategory
properties.jsdoc: Billing category of the event type.

properties.name: count
properties.jsdoc: Count of events associated with that event type and Application/User.

properties.name: eventType
properties.jsdoc: Event type

properties.name: id
properties.jsdoc: Id of the Application/User.

properties.name: name
properties.jsdoc: Name of the Application/User.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: This is the ID of document template.

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the table.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: The ID of the record

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: File name for the downloaded file

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: The content-type of the response. application/json will return a JSON payload with a base64 encoded file. application/octet-stream will download the file directly.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the file that is returned. Default is "pdf".

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: Margin formatted as top right bottom left, separated by spaces. Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: Unit of measurement for the margin. Default is "in". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size. Default is "A4". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: orientation
parameters.description: Page orientation. Default is "portrait". Add to override the value set in the template builder.

parameters.name: realm
parameters.description: Your Quickbase domain, for example demo.quickbase.com

returnTypeDetails.name: fileName
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The file name.

returnTypeDetails.name: data
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: Base64 encoded file content.

returnTypeDetails.name: contentType
returnTypeDetails.jsdoc: The document content type.
